settings.title: What is Veganism?
settings.subtitle:
Veganism is the practice of abstaining from the use of animal products, particularly in diet, and an associated philosophy that rejects the commodity status of animals.

A follower of veganism is known as a vegan. Distinctions are sometimes made between several categories of veganism.
settings.desc:
Dietary vegans also called "strict vegetarians" eschew all animal flesh and by-products, such as eggs or dairy.

Ethical vegans reject the commodification of animals. They do not eat meat because they oppose the practices involved in the process of packaging meat products.

Environmental vegans focus on conservation, rejecting the idea that it is necessary to consume animals to sustain human life.

settings.title: What is Perfy Vegan Soda?
settings.desc:
Vegan soda is a type of carbonated soft drink that does not contain any animal products. This includes ingredients such as milk, cream, or honey.

Perfy vegan soda utilizes all-natural ingredients including natural sweeteners like stevia, monk fruit, and allulose, real fruit juices, and nootropics and adaptogens.

These ingredients are not only vegan but also keto-friendly, low carb, low sugar, and gluten-free!
